form.longName: PhenX Substances Lifetime Abuse And Dependence - PX031401
form.preferredDefinition: Measurement of respondent's signs of substance abuse and dependence. These responses correspond with criteria from the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders (4th ed.; DSM-IV). There are two questions within each of which are multiple parts.

question.questionText: Did you ever use marijuana at least 21 times in a single year?
Has there ever been a period of a month or more when a great deal of your time was spent using marijuana, getting marijuana, or getting over its effects?
Because of your marijuana use, did you ever experience any of the following: Feeling depressed or uninterested in things for more than 24 hours to the point that it interfered with your functioning?

Because of your marijuana use, did you ever experience any of the following: Having trouble concentrating or having such trouble thinking clearly for more than 24 hours that it interfered with your functioning?
Because of your marijuana use, did you ever experience any of the following: Feeling paranoid or suspicious of people for more than 24 hours to the point that it interfered with your relationships?
Because of your marijuana use, did you ever experience any of the following: Decreased contact with friends or family?
Because of your marijuana use, did you ever experience any of the following: Hearing, seeing, or smelling things that weren't really there?
Did you continue to use marijuana after you knew it caused this? Feeling depressed or uninterested in things for more than 24 hours to the point that it interfered with your functioning?
Did you continue to use marijuana after you knew it caused this? Having trouble concentrating or having such trouble thinking clearly for more than 24 hours that it interfered with your functioning?
Did you continue to use marijuana after you knew it caused this? Feeling paranoid or suspicious of people for more than 24 hours to the point that it interfered with your relationships?
Did you continue to use marijuana after you knew it caused this? Decreased contact with friends or family?
Did you continue to use marijuana after you knew it caused this? Hearing, seeing, or smelling things that weren't really there?
Have you often wanted to stop or cut down on marijuana?
Have you ever tried to stop or cut down on marijuana but found you couldn't?
Were you unable to stop or cut down 3 or more times?
Have you often used marijuana more frequently or in larger amounts than you intended to?
Did you ever need larger amounts of marijuana to get an effect, or did you ever find that you could no longer get high on the amount you used to use?

When you stopped, cut down, or went without marijuana, did you ever experience any of these following problems for most of the day for 2 days or longer? Did you feel nervous, tense, restless or irritable?
When you stopped, cut down, or went without marijuana, did you ever experience any of these following problems for most of the day for 2 days or longer? Did you have trouble sleeping?
When you stopped, cut down, or went without marijuana, did you ever experience any of these following problems for most of the day for 2 days or longer? Did you tremble or twitch?
When you stopped, cut down, or went without marijuana, did you ever experience any of these following problems for most of the day for 2 days or longer? Did you sweat or have a fever?
When you stopped, cut down, or went without marijuana, did you ever experience any of these following problems for most of the day for 2 days or longer? Did you have nausea or vomiting?
When you stopped, cut down, or went without marijuana, did you ever experience any of these following problems for most of the day for 2 days or longer? Did you have diarrhea or stomach aches?

When you stopped, cut down, or went without marijuana, did you ever experience any of these following problems for most of the day for 2 days or longer? Did you have a marked increase or decrease in appetite, that is, have a significant change from your normal level?
Have you ever used marijuana to keep from having any of these problems (or to make them go away)?

instruction.text: [marijuana_use_21times_ayear]<>'1' and ([marijuana_withdrawal_restless]<>'5' and [marijuana_withdrawal_sleeplessness]<>'5' and [marijuana_withdrawal_tremble]<>'5' and [marijuana_withdrawal_sweat]<>'5' and [marijuana_withdrawal_nausea]<>'5' and..TRUNCATED

question.questionText: Did this happen 3 or more times?

instruction.text: [marijuana_use_21times_ayear]<>'1' and ([marijuana_withdrawal_restless]<>'5' and [marijuana_withdrawal_sleeplessness]<>'5' and [marijuana_withdrawal_tremble]<>'5' and [marijuana_withdrawal_sweat]<>'5' and [marijuana_withdrawal_nausea]<>'5' and..TRUNCATED

question.questionText: Did these problems ever occur together?

instruction.text: [marijuana_use_21times_ayear]<>'1' and ([marijuana_withdrawal_restless]<>'5' and [marijuana_withdrawal_sleeplessness]<>'5' and [marijuana_withdrawal_tremble]<>'5' and [marijuana_withdrawal_sweat]<>'5' and [marijuana_withdrawal_nausea]<>'5' and..TRUNCATED

question.questionText: Have you given up or greatly reduced important activities like sports, work, or associating with friends or relatives while using marijuana?
Has this happened 3 or more times, or did it last a month or longer?

(HAND RESPONDENT CARD G) Have you ever used any of these drugs to feel good or high, or to feel more active or alert? Or did you use any prescription drugs when they were not prescribed, or more than prescribed? Cocaine.

(HAND RESPONDENT CARD G) Have you ever used any of these drugs to feel good or high, or to feel more active or alert? Or did you use any prescription drugs when they were not prescribed, or more than prescribed? Stimulants.

(HAND RESPONDENT CARD G) Have you ever used any of these drugs to feel good or high, or to feel more active or alert? Or did you use any prescription drugs when they were not prescribed, or more than prescribed? Sedatives.

(HAND RESPONDENT CARD G) Have you ever used any of these drugs to feel good or high, or to feel more active or alert? Or did you use any prescription drugs when they were not prescribed, or more than prescribed? Opiates.

(HAND RESPONDENT CARD G) Have you ever used any of these drugs to feel good or high, or to feel more active or alert? Or did you use any prescription drugs when they were not prescribed, or more than prescribed? PCP.

(HAND RESPONDENT CARD G) Have you ever used any of these drugs to feel good or high, or to feel more active or alert? Or did you use any prescription drugs when they were not prescribed, or more than prescribed? Hallucinogens.

(HAND RESPONDENT CARD G) Have you ever used any of these drugs to feel good or high, or to feel more active or alert? Or did you use any prescription drugs when they were not prescribed, or more than prescribed? Solvents.

(HAND RESPONDENT CARD G) Have you ever used any of these drugs to feel good or high, or to feel more active or alert? Or did you use any prescription drugs when they were not prescribed, or more than prescribed? Combination Drugs.

(HAND RESPONDENT CARD G) Have you ever used any of these drugs to feel good or high, or to feel more active or alert? Or did you use any prescription drugs when they were not prescribed, or more than prescribed? Other.
How many times in your life have you used Cocaine?

instruction.text: datatype=number;[marijuana_use_21times_ayear]<>'1' and [marijuana_use_prevent_activities] <> '1' and ([cocaine_lifetime_use] <> '1' or [stimulants_lifetime_use] <> '1' or [sedatives_lifetime_use] <> '1' or [opiates_lifetime_use] <> '1' or [pcp_lifetime_use] <..TRUNCATED

question.questionText: Was there ever a period of a month or more when a great deal of your time was spent using Cocaine, getting Cocaine, or getting over its effects?
Was there ever a period of a month or more when a great deal of your time was spent using Stimulants, getting Stimulants, or getting over its effects?
Was there ever a period of a month or more when a great deal of your time was spent using Sedatives, getting Sedatives, or getting over its effects?
Was there ever a period of a month or more when a great deal of your time was spent using Opiates, getting Opiates, or getting over its effects?
Was there ever a period of a month or more when a great deal of your time was spent using Other Drugs, getting Other Drugs, or getting over its effects?
Have you often wanted to stop or cut down on Cocaine?
Have you often wanted to stop or cut down on Stimulants?
Have you often wanted to stop or cut down on Sedatives?
Have you often wanted to stop or cut down on Opiates?
Have you often wanted to stop or cut down on Other Drugs?
Have you ever tried to stop or cut down on Cocaine but found that you couldn't?
Have you ever tried to stop or cut down on Stimulants but found that you couldn't?
Have you ever tried to stop or cut down on Sedatives but found that you couldn't?
Have you ever tried to stop or cut down on Opiates but found that you couldn't?
Have you ever tried to stop or cut down on Other Drugs but found that you couldn't?
Were you unable to stop or cut down 3 or more times on Cocaine?
Were you unable to stop or cut down 3 or more times on Stimulants?
Were you unable to stop or cut down 3 or more times on Sedatives?
Were you unable to stop or cut down 3 or more times on Opiates?
Were you unable to stop or cut down 3 or more times on Other Drugs?
Did you ever need larger amounts of Cocaine to get an effect or find that you could no longer get high on the amount you used to use?
Did you ever need larger amounts of Stimulants to get an effect or find that you could no longer get high on the amount you used to use?
Did you ever need larger amounts of Sedatives to get an effect or find that you could no longer get high on the amount you used to use?
Did you ever need larger amounts of Opiates to get an effect or find that you could no longer get high on the amount you used to use?
Did you ever need larger amounts of Other Drugs to get an effect or find that you could no longer get high on the amount you used to use?
Have you ever given up or greatly reduced important activities while using Cocaine, like sports, work, or associating with friends or relatives?
Have you ever given up or greatly reduced important activities while using Stimulants, like sports, work, or associating with friends or relatives?
Have you ever given up or greatly reduced important activities while using Sedatives, like sports, work, or associating with friends or relatives?
Have you ever given up or greatly reduced important activities while using Opiates, like sports, work, or associating with friends or relatives?
Have you ever given up or greatly reduced important activities while using Other Drugs, like sports, work, or associating with friends or relatives?
Did this (given up or reduced using Cocaine) happen 3 or more times or for a month or more?
Did this (given up or reduced using Stimulants) happen 3 or more times or for a month or more?
Did this (given up or reduced using Sedatives) happen 3 or more times or for a month or more?
Did this (given up or reduced using Opiates) happen 3 or more times or for a month or more?
Did this (given up or reduced using Other Drugs) happen 3 or more times or for a month or more?
Have you often used Cocaine more days or in larger amounts than you intended to?
Have you often used Stimulants more days or in larger amounts than you intended to?
Have you often used Sedatives more days or in larger amounts than you intended to?
Have you often used Opiates more days or in larger amounts than you intended to?
Have you often used Other Drugs more days or in larger amounts than you intended to?

People who stop, cut down, or go without drugs after using drugs steadily for some time may not feel well. These feelings are more intense and can last longer than the usual hangover. When you stopped, cut down, or went without Cocaine, did you ever experience any of the following problems for most of the day for 2 days or longer? Did you feel depressed?

People who stop, cut down, or go without drugs after using drugs steadily for some time may not feel well. These feelings are more intense and can last longer than the usual hangover. When you stopped, cut down, or went without Stimulants, did you ever experience any of the following problems for most of the day for 2 days or longer? Did you feel depressed?

People who stop, cut down, or go without drugs after using drugs steadily for some time may not feel well. These feelings are more intense and can last longer than the usual hangover. When you stopped, cut down, or went without Sedatives, did you ever experience any of the following problems for most of the day for 2 days or longer? Did you feel depressed?

People who stop, cut down, or go without drugs after using drugs steadily for some time may not feel well. These feelings are more intense and can last longer than the usual hangover. When you stopped, cut down, or went without Opiates, did you ever experience any of the following problems for most of the day for 2 days or longer? Did you feel depressed?

People who stop, cut down, or go without drugs after using drugs steadily for some time may not feel well. These feelings are more intense and can last longer than the usual hangover. Did you have a strong desire or craving for Other Drugs?

People who stop, cut down, or go without drugs after using drugs steadily for some time may not feel well. These feelings are more intense and can last longer than the usual hangover. When you stopped, cut down, or went without Cocaine, did you ever experience any of the following problems for most of the day for 2 days or longer? Did you feel slowed down, like you could hardly move?

People who stop, cut down, or go without drugs after using drugs steadily for some time may not feel well. These feelings are more intense and can last longer than the usual hangover. When you stopped, cut down, or went without Cocaine, did you ever experience any of the following problems for most of the day for 2 days or longer? Did you have an increase in appetite?

Was there ever a time when 2 or more of these problems occurred together because of stopping, cutting down on, or going without Cocaine?
Was there ever a time when 2 or more of these problems occurred together because of stopping, cutting down on, or going without Stimulants?

protocol.preferredDefinition: Measurement of respondent's signs of substance abuse and dependence. These responses correspond with criteria from the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders (4th ed.; DSM-IV). There are two questions within each of which are multiple parts.

form.preferredDefinition: This measure assesses if an individual has had a myocardial infarction (MI) through collection of personal history of disease, treatment and procedure histories, and medical record abstraction.

question.questionText: Has a doctor ever told you that you had a myocardial infarction or heart attack?
Have you had an outpatient or day surgery procedure to unblock blocked or narrowed blood vessels of the heart (called a PTCA, coronary angioplasty, stent, or atherectomy)?
Was there an acute episode of pain, discomfort or tightness in the chest, left arm or jaw within 72 hours of the hospitalization or within 72 hours of the inhospital event?
Was the discomfort or pain diagnosed as having a noncardiac origin?
Were electrocardiograms (ECGs or EKGs) recorded?
Dates of ECGs image
Were any cardiac enzyme measurements performed during this admission?
Did the participant have any active liver disease (cirrhosis, hepatitis, liver cancer, etc.)?
Did the participant have any active liver disease (cirrhosis, hepatitis, liver cancer, etc.)? If Yes specify.
Is there any mention of the participant having either trauma, a surgical procedure, or rhabdomyolysis within one week prior to the measurement of the cardiac enzymes?

Is there any mention of the participant having either trauma, a surgical procedure, or rhabdomyolysis within one week prior to the measurement of the cardiac enzymes? If Yes specify date of trauma or procedure.

Is there any mention of the participant having either trauma, a surgical procedure, or rhabdomyolysis within one week prior to the measurement of the cardiac enzymes? If Yes specify type of trauma or procedure.
Enzyme Chart image
Enzyme Chart image 2

Record all serum enzyme values Normal Range
Record all serum enzyme values Lowest enzyme value

Record all serum enzyme values Date (mm/dd/yy)
Record all serum enzyme values Time (hh:mm am/pm)
Myocardial infarction
Myocardial infarction Date
Chest Pain
Cardiac Enzymes
ECG Serial Reading (pick one)

validValue.meaningText: Evolution of ST-T Elevation with or without Q-Wave
validValue.description: Evolution of ST-T Elevation with or without Q-Wave

validValue.meaningText: Single ECG with LBBB, described as new
validValue.description: Single ECG with LBBB, described as new

question.questionText: Procedurerelated

protocol.preferredDefinition: This measure assesses if an individual has had a myocardial infarction (MI) through collection of personal history of disease, treatment and procedure histories, and medical record abstraction.

form.preferredDefinition: This measure begins with a set of interviewer-administered questions about whether the person has been told by a physician that he or she has poor blood flow to the legs or blocked or narrowed arteries to the legs and whether they have had any procedures, such as angiography, angioplasty, or surgery, for the condition. A protocol is provided to assess the presence of peripheral arterial disease (PAD) using the ankle brachial index (ABI). The ABI involves the use of ultrasound to measure blood pressure.

question.questionText: Did a doctor ever say that you had claudication or peripheral arterial disease (poor blood flow to the legs or blocked or narrowed arteries to the legs)? Do not include varicose veins or phlebitis.
For the above condition have you ever had... Angiography (dye in the arteries of the legs)?
For the above condition have you ever had... Angioplasty (balloon catheter to open blockage)?
For the above condition have you ever had... Surgery to improve blood flow in your legs (do not include surgery for varicose veins)?
Blood pressure measurement, sphygmomanometer name and model.
Blood pressure measurement, cuff size for arm.
Blood pressure measurement, cuff size for ankle.
Arterial Blood Pressure Measurement. Measure systolic blood pressure of: Right brachial artery (Q1a) (mm Hg).
Arterial Blood Pressure Measurement. Measure systolic blood pressure of: Right dorsalis pedis artery (Q1b)
Arterial Blood Pressure Measurement. Measure systolic blood pressure of: Right posterior tibial artery (Q1c) (mm Hg).
Arterial Blood Pressure Measurement. Measure systolic blood pressure of: Left posterior tibial artery (Q1d) (mm Hg).
Arterial Blood Pressure Measurement. Measure systolic blood pressure of: Left dorsalis pedis artery (Q1e) (mm Hg).
Arterial Blood Pressure Measurement. Measure systolic blood pressure of: Left brachial artery (Q1f) (mm Hg).
Right ABI = (the higher of the right posterior tibial SBP or the right dorsalis pedis SBP) / (the higher arm SBP)
LEFT ABI = (the higher of the left posterior tibial SBP or the left dorsalis pedis SBP) / (the higher arm SBP)

protocol.preferredDefinition: This measure begins with a set of interviewer-administered questions about whether the person has been told by a physician that he or she has poor blood flow to the legs or blocked or narrowed arteries to the legs and whether they have had any procedures, such as angiography, angioplasty, or surgery, for the condition. A protocol is provided to assess the presence of peripheral arterial disease (PAD) using the ankle brachial index (ABI). The ABI involves the use of ultrasound to measure blood pressure.

form.preferredDefinition: Measure to assess the presence of an abdominal aortic aneurysm through the use of ultrasound.

question.questionText: Have you ever been diagnosed by a doctor as having an abdominal aortic aneurysm?
Have you had surgery or other repair for this aneurysm?
Ultrasound machine name and model.
Maximum transverse diameter (cm) of the aorta.
Maximum anteriorposterior diameter (cm) in the longitudinal plane.
Maximum aortic diameter (cm).
Ultrasound scan image ID.

protocol.preferredDefinition: Measure to assess the presence of an abdominal aortic aneurysm through the use of ultrasound.

form.longName: PhenX Arrhythmia Atrial And Ventricular - PX041101
form.preferredDefinition: Measure to assess presence of arrhythmias through collection of personal history, treatments and procedures, medication usage, and administration of an electrocardiograph (ECG).

question.questionText: Have you been told you have/had a heart rhythm problem called atrial fibrillation?

protocol.preferredDefinition: Measure to assess presence of arrhythmias through collection of personal history, treatments and procedures, medication usage, and administration of an electrocardiograph (ECG).
